Package repositories

Interface DataRepository

All Known Implementing Classes:
PostgreAdapter
public interface DataRepository
This DataRepository interface is the one that Services will interact with instead of a concrete database implementation, this way we can swap out Postgre and use MySql, or cloud service , or even txt file
See Also:
  • PostgreAdapter

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      boolean createUser(User u)
      This is called in Services when they want to save a new User to their Repositories Password should be hashed
      Parameters:
      u - an User object which include all username,email,password (hashed)
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying whether we have successfully add the user in the database.

    • deleteUser

      boolean deleteUser(User u)
      This is called in Services when admin want to delete a new User from their Repositories
      Parameters:
      u - an User object which only need to include username.
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying whether we have successfully delete the user from the database.

    • editUser

      boolean editUser(User u)
      This is called in Services when they want to edit a new User in their Repositories. Bro what are we gonna edit with just username,email,password?
      Parameters:
      u - an User object
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying whether we have successfully edit the user in the database.

    • addEvent

      int addEvent(Event event)
      This is called in Services when they want to add a new Event in their Repositories. it will also trigger addParticipant(int,int) as we need to add participants(including the host)
      Parameters:
      event - an Event object
      Returns:
      an int specifying the event ID we just created.

    • deleteEvent

      boolean deleteEvent(int eventID)
      This is called in Services when they want to delete Event from their Repositories.
      Parameters:
      eventID - an int specifying the id of the event we want to delete
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying whether we have successfully delete the from the database.

    • editEvent

      boolean editEvent(Event event)
      This is called in Services when they want to edit an Event in their Repositories.
      Parameters:
      event - an Event object which must include an eventID for specifying the event they want to change,and the rest of the attribute is for changing the event
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying whether we have successfully edited the database.

    • findEventsFromUser

      List<Event> findEventsFromUser(User u)
      This is called in Services when they want to find all events associated with a user.
      Parameters:
      u - a User object which must include a userID and a username for finding all related event. I feel like this is a bad design decision, should it just include userID or username?
      Returns:
      a List of Event in which either the user participate or host

    • addParticipant

      boolean addParticipant(int eid, int uid)
      This is called in Services when they want add a participant to an event.
      Parameters:
      eid - a int can also add host of the event as a participant
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating whether the participant has been added to the event

    • addUserToPending

      boolean addUserToPending(User u)
      This is called in Services when the user need verifying before being actually put in the repositories. They will be put in a temporary database first.
      Parameters:
      u - a User including email,username,hashed password
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating whether the user has been added to the temporary database. Should be false if there are duplicate tuple of (username,email)

    • deleteUserFromPending

      int deleteUserFromPending(String username)
      This is called in Services when a user has been verified and we need to remove similar usernames, which are not verified, from tmp repo.
      Parameters:
      username - a String showing the name we need to remove
      Returns:
      an int indicating number of entries removed from the tmp repo.

    • findUserInPending

      User findUserInPending(String username, String email)
      This is called in Services when a user has been verified and we need to get the user out from tmp repo.
      Parameters:
      username - a String showing the name of the verified user
      email - a String showing the email of the verified user
      Returns:
      a User which should be collected from the tmp repo.should return null if there is no such user.

    • checkIfUsernameExist

      boolean checkIfUsernameExist(String username)

    • showHashedPassword

      String showHashedPassword(String username)
      Returns:
      a String showing the hashed password, should be null if the username does not exist in the repo

    • findOwnerOfEvent

      User findOwnerOfEvent(int eid)
      Returns:
      a User object,which only include username,email,uid and NOT a list of events. Should be null if the eid does not exist in the repo.

    • findEventByID

      Event findEventByID(int eid)
      Returns:
      a fully populated Event object. Should be null if the eid does not exist in the repo.

    • findUserByName

      User findUserByName(String name)
      Returns:
      an User object including username,email,userID Should be null if the name does not exist in the repo.

    • findAllUser

      List<User> findAllUser()
      Returns:
      a List of User object including username,email,userID

    • deleteUser

      int deleteUser(String username)
      this is called when admin wants to delete a specific user.
      Parameters:
      username - : the name of the user the admin wants to delete
      Returns:
      int: the number of User deleted. Return 0 if username does not exist. In normal case it should return 1 because the username is unique.
